commit_message:
Make legacy java gate working

Changed the user in condition to be `zuul` instead of `jenkins`.
Fix warning from shellcheck.
Don't clone entire history (depth 1) of git repository.

Based on change for monasca-persister:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I2a55559cfb87c9353cce1a70d26b13f9322bc511

Change-Id: I4c07eac73e27d102c31c7506f85a63b379a9fb53
(cherry picked from commit 1a8bb25ebc478e5d1bba80a4297b0a50a22afe8d)

commit_message:
Ceph-rgw: Update s3 default admin keys

This updates the ceph-rgw s3 admin access and secret keys to more
generic default values to avoid the possibility of a user assuming
the default keys are acceptable to use

Change-Id: I618ec16059e12c8ce74513da7580a9853af707df

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ibe9f2788f0c4f50ab13b6979f2c79e016e07281d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 10:55:58.000000000', 'message': "Run online data migrations

We always run DB sync in deploy_tasks, ensuring that the database is
up to date. We should follow up with online data migrations
too.

Doing this via docker_config has 2 purposes:

* We can easily ensure this happens in a container with the right
  config files mounted.

* We can even apply this via a minor update. This is important because
  we'll have to backport this all the way to Pike and apply it there
  using Pike containers, before upgrading to Queens containers.

There's an additional issue to consider: In Puppet service variant we
ran the online migrations for release X before upgrading to X+1, but
the proposed Docker variant migrations for X run with upgrade to
X. This means that when switching from non-containerized to
containerized, we'll need to run migrations twice, to correctly switch
between the aforementioned approaches.

Change-Id: I2eb6c7c42d7e7aea4a78a892790e42bc5371f792
Closes-Bug: #1790474
(cherry picked from commit 16405ff92842b4a3583edae00590c3fc760a05c9)
(cherry picked from commit f2680ceb71117b1c0b55142ff137c4098aab8583)
"}]
commit_message:
Run online data migrations

We always run DB sync in deploy_tasks, ensuring that the database is
up to date. We should follow up with online data migrations
too.

Doing this via docker_config has 2 purposes:

* We can easily ensure this happens in a container with the right
  config files mounted.

* We can even apply this via a minor update. This is important because
  we'll have to backport this all the way to Pike and apply it there
  using Pike containers, before upgrading to Queens containers.

There's an additional issue to consider: In Puppet service variant we
ran the online migrations for release X before upgrading to X+1, but
the proposed Docker variant migrations for X run with upgrade to
X. This means that when switching from non-containerized to
containerized, we'll need to run migrations twice, to correctly switch
between the aforementioned approaches.

Change-Id: I2eb6c7c42d7e7aea4a78a892790e42bc5371f792
Closes-Bug: #1790474
(cherry picked from commit 16405ff92842b4a3583edae00590c3fc760a05c9)
(cherry picked from commit f2680ceb71117b1c0b55142ff137c4098aab8583)

[{'created': '2018-09-06 12:29:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix local (non-root) docker build support

This was broken recently in a2229e738ae1d52cfa39b00972925e505fdca292
where the buildah support hard coded the modify command so that
it required a 'sudo' for the docker version.

Docker does not always require root for these commands. Also,
need to look further as to why buildah required this.

Change-Id: Iae231ec8bc8dc2822fc3d6bfab593cff3c599910
"}]
commit_message:
Fix local (non-root) docker build support

This was broken recently in a2229e738ae1d52cfa39b00972925e505fdca292
where the buildah support hard coded the modify command so that
it required a 'sudo' for the docker version.

Docker does not always require root for these commands. Also,
need to look further as to why buildah required this.

Change-Id: Iae231ec8bc8dc2822fc3d6bfab593cff3c599910

commit_message:
Revert "tempest: temporarily disable some tests until bug 1789878 is fixed"

Made posible now that bug/1789878 is fixed in networking-bagpipe
stable/queens ( https://review.openstack.org/600377 ).

This reverts commit 036b177ac0a2712207c9b2dccbb7df015ebaaef7.

Change-Id: I0f5b0837b391fd8030f9cd1aec5a42f67a08c397

commit_message:
add lib-forward-testing-python3 test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a functional test job
running under Python 3 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ib006f24d774f5e18361450fdfa8725ed76fff410
Story: #2002586
Task: #24288

[{'created': '2018-08-27 19:46:03.000000000', 'message': 'ScaleIO: Prevent usage of unsafe volumes

It is possible for volumes, created from storage pools
which have zero-padding disabled, to contain previous data. This
change prevents these volumes from being created by default. A
user can override this behavior by acknowleding the possibility
with a configuration option.

This is a squash of the four commits that led to the final state in
rocky to not allow the creation of any type of non-zero-padded volumes
to be created. This adds a config option that defaults to the safe

behavior, but it should be acceptable in this case so that the security

Closes-Bug: #1784871

Change-Id: I62f8f48b1624fc9abb7427bd4ca51f7873d35b96

'}]
commit_message:
ScaleIO: Prevent usage of unsafe volumes

It is possible for volumes, created from storage pools
which have zero-padding disabled, to contain previous data. This
change prevents these volumes from being created by default. A
user can override this behavior by acknowleding the possibility
with a configuration option.

This is a squash of the four commits that led to the final state in
rocky to not allow the creation of any type of non-zero-padded volumes
to be created. This adds a config option that defaults to the safe
behavior. It is backporting a new config option, and a change in default
behavior, but it should be acceptable in this case so that the security
vulnerability can be addressed.

Closes-Bug: #1784871

Change-Id: I62f8f48b1624fc9abb7427bd4ca51f7873d35b96
Closes-bug: #1699573
(cherry picked from commit 7feb62197d371ab7253dc86a34af6ff8b484b4df)
(cherry picked from commit 949cc46e162e00092aa85a7be921649c8dbf2bf8)
(cherry picked from commit 8d0dea694a366cb3797748d389ca76b7864af16f)
(cherry picked from commit 13a6689ccb7751c9f9b5c37ce0a3f75eb7665a95)

commit_message:
Remove fdb entries for ha router interfaces when going DOWN

When HA router's interface on host is going DOWN but router
is still available on this host, L2 population
mechanism driver will now send to other hosts info to remove
fdb unicast entries to this port on host.

It will not send FLOODING_ENTRY because this port is still on
host but in standby mode and might be transformed to master
in future.

This solves issue with migration router from Legacy to HA.
In such case, port which was originally attached to legacy
router is transformed to be HA backup port before changing
its status to DOWN.
Now in such case unicast entries to this port and backup
node will be removed properly so packets to HA router will
be really send to host which is master node for router.

Closes-Bug: #1785582

Change-Id: Icc14e5f5d40fc6fbb49e0f7b18cc3b15ebec8508
(cherry picked from commit 6c300b1a9b3f0db82b4edd84eda74600d28b7185)

[{'created': '2018-09-06 08:25:13.000000000', 'message': 'bgpvpn: override NORMAL action in ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE

Bug 1789878 describes why the current implementation of traffic
redirection for router fallback has been defeated by change
Ib6ced838a7ec6d5c459a8475318556001c31bdf which was brought in the neutron
ovs firewalling code.

This change moves the place where we put a higher priority
rule to override the NORMAL action to the ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE,
which is added by I60d299275effd9ef35c8007773d3c9fcabfa50fa to
re-introduce a single table where NORMAL happens for egress traffic.

To allow this change to pass the lower-constraints requirement
check job is temporarily set to non-voting, because this job
does not seem to be able to take into account the fact that the
master branch needs neutron master.

Change-Id: I8923ca9583b3337556aaf98b4f25732ea6b7bb1c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598593
Closes-Bug: 1789878
(cherry picked from commit 3867733d640fff4d70288ce845173c86b2b0b8af)

commit_message:
bgpvpn: override NORMAL action in ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE

Bug 1789878 describes why the current implementation of traffic
redirection for router fallback has been defeated by change
Ib6ced838a7ec6d5c459a8475318556001c31bdf which was brought in the neutron
ovs firewalling code.

This change moves the place where we put a higher priority
rule to override the NORMAL action to the ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE,
which is added by I60d299275effd9ef35c8007773d3c9fcabfa50fa to
re-introduce a single table where NORMAL happens for egress traffic.

This change anticipates the release of neutron 13.0.1 which
will include https://review.openstack.org/599622 . A simple
recheck will be sufficient to progress this change once the
actual release has been made.

Change-Id: I8923ca9583b3337556aaf98b4f25732ea6b7bb1c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/599622
Closes-Bug: 1789878
(cherry picked from commit 3867733d640fff4d70288ce845173c86b2b0b8af)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 11:52:08.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Deleting snapshot that is source of multiple volumes fails

Deleting a snapshot which is the source of multiple volumes fails with
the error: "The number of source and target devices must be equal". This
patch rectifies the issue by unlinking source and target volumes
individually where a single volume is a source of multiple targets.

Change-Id: I4b0c171051622f62aba1238c3b84d8a2c8bad6dc
Closes-bug: 1768047
(cherry picked from commit 6c3ab364799302b9cab7afc721abf73b5b97c890)
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Deleting snapshot that is source of multiple volumes fails

Deleting a snapshot which is the source of multiple volumes fails with
the error: "The number of source and target devices must be equal". This
patch rectifies the issue by unlinking source and target volumes
individually where a single volume is a source of multiple targets.

Change-Id: I4b0c171051622f62aba1238c3b84d8a2c8bad6dc
Closes-bug: 1768047
(cherry picked from commit 6c3ab364799302b9cab7afc721abf73b5b97c890)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia5d8804ea182b11f45c9458d343fade03bfd8363
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

commit_message:
Cleanup zuul.yaml

Couple of cleanups:
* Use openstack-lower-constraints-template, remove jobs that are part
  of templates.
* Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
  in the check queue only. Remove post job.
* Sort list of templates.

Change-Id: I0f186ba675ecb5802ef6a84ac05727a8621d3768

subject: Remove deprecated raid_state and state attributes from python-dracclient
messages:
[{'account_id': 28782, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-09-07 21:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

This looks pretty good, but there are a few changes that I think we need to make:

We basically want to undo the change that the original patch made to deprecate these attributes.  It renamed the tuple from PhysicalDisk to PhysicalDiskTuple and created a PhysicalDisk class that it returned in the place of the tuple.  We want to delete the PhysicalDisk class and rename PhysicalDiskTuple to PhysicalDisk to undo that change.  The same applies with VirtualDisk and VirtualDiskTuple.  This will make it so that you (and users of the API) don't need to change references from PhysicalDisk to PhysicalDiskTuple in other places in the code.  The same goes for VirtualDisk too.

Finally, we need to make similar changes for Job.state here:
https://github.com/openstack/python-dracclient/blob/master/dracclient/resources/job.py#L41

Take a look at the original patch here:
https://github.com/openstack/python-dracclient/commit/9ff7c3197225d816df4c5fd04d2fcef6e39bc724

Thanks for the patch!"}, {'account_id': 28782, 'date': '2018-09-11 18:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601662/'}]

'}]

Remove ospurge legacy jobs

The ospurge project template and its
jobs will be moved to its repo.

See [1] for addition to repo and [2]
for the removal in project-config.

messages: [{'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-09-05 14:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-09-10 09:25:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-11 16:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 14:33:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix bluestore disk naming format in kolla

The current bluestore disk label naming is inconsistent with the
filestore. The filestore naming format is that the disk prefixes
belonging to the same osd are the same and the suffixes are
different.

This patch keeps the bluestore's disk naming as well.

Change-Id: I090cf055ebedc555b5ada35e140b7a7bb2a4cf8f
(cherry picked from commit 0f14b3d7e00e36b56c84dc193674828714f5ec7d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bluestore disk naming format in kolla

The current bluestore disk label naming is inconsistent with the
filestore. The filestore naming format is that the disk prefixes
belonging to the same osd are the same and the suffixes are
different.

This patch keeps the bluestore's disk naming as well.

Change-Id: I090cf055ebedc555b5ada35e140b7a7bb2a4cf8f
(cherry picked from commit 0f14b3d7e00e36b56c84dc193674828714f5ec7d)

commit_message:
Add user tab in project details view.

Add an extra tab "users" in the project details view which
displays the users which have a role on the project (the
members of the project).

The users are displayed in a table which is an extension
(inheritance) of the user table used in the Users panel.

An extra column is added to this table, displaying the
roles of each user on project

Only users which have directly a role on the project
are displayed, the users which have a role through a
group are not displayed.

Change-Id: I88b40fcda300ee4640155347d479a972abb2df02
Partial-Bug: #1785263

When the judgement of self.is_working() is false, it means the
backup service is not ready and the backup will be interrupted.
We will not allow to delete this backup util the backup service
is configured correctly and starts successfully.
This patch fix this, if the backup service was not working or we

This patch fix this, if the backup service was not working or we

Change-Id: I7163f026a497db8876c495d15bef9c006eadd17b

commit_message:
Save the backup.service just before _run_backup

When the judgement of self.is_working() is false, it means the
backup service is not ready and the backup will be interrupted.
We will not allow to delete this backup util the backup service
is configured correctly and starts successfully.
This patch fix this, if the backup service was not working or we
just used a wrong backup service at that time, and now we want to
cleanup the backups, it is OK to do backup delete. There is no
need to do more!

Change-Id: I7163f026a497db8876c495d15bef9c006eadd17b

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Task: #24288

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 16:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry to execution commands

There are quite a few instances where the "exec_command" function fails
due unrelated issues. This change adds a retry with a backoff. The exec
function will now retry 3 times in the event of an exception with a cool
down of 2 seconds. The play context for retries will also be set if
undefined making it possible to recover from transient UNREACHABLE
errors.

Change-Id: Ic7c7af49e1c5eba21216b33814b92e276e3fba3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add retry to execution commands

There are quite a few instances where the "exec_command" function fails
due unrelated issues. This change adds a retry with a backoff. The exec
function will now retry 3 times in the event of an exception with a cool
down of 2 seconds. The play context for retries will also be set if
undefined making it possible to recover from transient UNREACHABLE
errors.

Change-Id: Ic7c7af49e1c5eba21216b33814b92e276e3fba3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use templates lower-constraints, remove cover

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Remove cover job, this one is not working at all and always fails. If
anybody wants to enable it again, they can add the openstack-cover-jobs
template and fix it - I couldn't find an easy way to fix it without
knowledge of this repo.

Change-Id: I3b50c8384507d22339ed11f556dbe32181fe0518

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id790993b25243d6de36c327e79d3da7105331f04
Story: #2002586
Task: #24306

commit_message:
Grafana: Disable LDAP signup by default

This removes the configuration value for enabling LDAP signup by
default in the Grafana chart, which restricts the ability for a
user to sign up for Grafana access via the login page.

Change-Id: Ifed1dbf7eda022541d7a1ab179788c92763bc310

I was poking around in some IRC logs and was reminded of http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-swift/%23openstack-swift.2018-04-11.log.html#t2018-04-11T12:47:10

That *maybe* got fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507798/ ? Let's find out."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-14 00:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-20 20:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-27 16:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-28 16:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-28 20:06:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

recheck

The -ipv6 result sounds kind of like https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1768185 but that seems like a very old bug and I can't figure out how anything that landed in devstack over the last week would have changed things...

If this continues failing, we probably want to explicitly disable etcd3. (It's enabled by default for devstack-minimal.)"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-08-30 23:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-08-31 08:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-08-31 19:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

WIP until we have test runner infrastructure that can reliably test this'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-06 04:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-06 04:47:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Let's try it with just localhost? Will surely require some rechecks to get a feel for whether it's actually stable...

Maybe would be better to have it non-voting for now? I wonder how you disable retries on failure..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-07 23:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-08 02:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-10 05:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-09-10 18:51:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looking at the running logs, it looks to work with IPv6 world.

Only rsyncd is not running with IPv6 but IPv4[1]. However it's no effect because dsvm only runs functional tests, no probes running with that.

1: http://logs.openstack.org/97/591497/8/check/swift-dsvm-functional-ipv6/4b099ab/controller/logs/screen-s-object.txt.gz
2: http://logs.openstack.org/97/591497/8/check/swift-dsvm-functional-ipv6/4b099ab/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-09-10_05_17_22_417814"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-10 22:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-09-11 15:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-24 14:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove non-voting job from gate queue

The gate queue should never run a non-voting job, remove it. It gets
ignored and just wastes resources.

Change-Id: I2a331cdd80f4dcf1b1fc631c02aa77e852859552
'}]
commit_message:
Remove non-voting job from gate queue

The gate queue should never run a non-voting job, remove it. It gets
ignored and just wastes resources.

Change-Id: I2a331cdd80f4dcf1b1fc631c02aa77e852859552

ends up deploying overcloud as well

commit_message:
Testing adding properties to flavors

The additional properties are required for the nodes
to deploy successfully on OVB.

Closes-Bug: #1790770
Change-Id: I4f08ccd8849049d587782500c526097cf24d150d

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for building docs

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: I86d2460231d246005cfdace75c50dc54c137f0ca

commit_message:
Revert "Use nested virt in scenario jobs"

Nested virt doesn't work well on infra nodes.
This reverts commit 190755866c6dbbd735dcae3ee9434c8f03722763.

Change-Id: I43eeb502ba07cf5745a17015df7fdc7120df6eaa
Closes-Bug: #1788006

commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-cover template

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Remove jobs and use template instead.

Change-Id: I4a7b469024442d30d60c572dde229f5b9fb4d0b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 14:51:32.000000000', 'message': "Improve iSCSI device detection speed

Current iSCSI device detection checks for the presence of devices based
on the scan time, so it checks for presence, sleeps, scans, and checks
again.  This means that if the device becomes available while we sleep
to send another scan we won't detect the device.

This patch changes this, making the searching and the rescanning
independent operations operating at different cadences.

Checking for the device will happen every seconds, and the rescans will
happen after 4, 9, and 16 seconds.

Change-Id: I716a3ea8583e289819cc37b6b5dd9730dd59406b
"}]
commit_message:
Improve iSCSI device detection speed

Current iSCSI device detection checks for the presence of devices based
on the scan time, so it checks for presence, sleeps, scans, and checks
again.  This means that if the device becomes available while we sleep
to send another scan we won't detect the device.

This patch changes this, making the searching and the rescanning
independent operations operating at different cadences.

Checking for the device will happen every seconds, and the rescans will
happen after 4, 9, and 16 seconds.

Change-Id: I716a3ea8583e289819cc37b6b5dd9730dd59406b

commit_message:
Bootstrap ansible virtualenv with --never-download

To prevent virtualenv trying to download the latest pip/setuptools
when creating the venv, and failing due to pip.conf during an upgrade,
we tell it not to do that and rather just use whatever it already has.

Closes-Bug: #1790158
Change-Id: I8424de61534e9ba7853e4366834d005d5cd8ec92
(cherry picked from commit 2bc1ca0c8176a653cf1e07189e2a57e053650138)

commit_message:
undercloud: support noop management interface for snmp and ipmi

We're replacing the usage of the "fake" interface for snmp with
the new "noop" one. It will also be enabled for ipmi.

Change-Id: I05cca0eee30134d99a45d2dc44a8d370e7004eac
Story: #2003203

subject: Add lxc3 compatibility
messages:
[{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-08-07 07:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I thought we said we should evaluate the tooling to migrate instead, but I am okay to use lxc3 everywhere. It just brings a harder upgrade path.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-08-07 08:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I thought we said we should evaluate the tooling to migrate
 > instead, but I am okay to use lxc3 everywhere. It just brings a
 > harder upgrade path.

This patch addresses greenfield installs in a clean manner, and I reasoned that the time required to properly implement the upgrade tool and in particular make it idempotent could not be justified when the priority is to make bionic work.

We can address in-place operating system upgrades at a later point if required.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-08-12 06:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-08-12 08:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-13 10:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 762463f850e0010f0ec1bbc2bd7689886779a51d'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2018-09-09 23:03:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

The lookup('pipe'...) doesn't work for me.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567032/ adds a test to the physical_host of a container as to which version of lxc it's running, and sets 'lxc_three_syntax' to true/false. Would it be reasonable to swap it out or utilize that test instead somehow?"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-10 07:58:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > The lookup('pipe'...) doesn't work for me.
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567032/ adds a test to the
 > physical_host of a container as to which version of lxc it's
 > running, and sets 'lxc_three_syntax' to true/false. Would it be
 > reasonable to swap it out or utilize that test instead somehow?

Hi Erik,

You are absolutely right that the lookup is incorrect.

The complication here is that the legacy config keys are currently
defined in openstack-ansible group_vars rather than within
either the cinder or neutron roles. This clearly needs further
attention and a more invasive fix, probably within those roles."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-11 13:37:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > The lookup('pipe'...) doesn't work for me.
 > >
 > > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567032/ adds a test to the
 > > physical_host of a container as to which version of lxc it's
 > > running, and sets 'lxc_three_syntax' to true/false. Would it be
 > > reasonable to swap it out or utilize that test instead somehow?
 > 
 > Hi Erik,
 > 
 > You are absolutely right that the lookup is incorrect.
 > 
 > The complication here is that the legacy config keys are currently
 > defined in openstack-ansible group_vars rather than within
 > either the cinder or neutron roles. This clearly needs further
 > attention and a more invasive fix, probably within those roles.

@Erik this is the start of a possible fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601534/"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 12:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add lxc3 compatibility

lxc3 deprecates many legacy config keys [1].

This change ensures that containers created on systems with lxc3
use the appropriate apparmor config keys. At this point we do not
need to address lxc2->lxc3 upgrades as these would only occur
during a Xenial->Bionic in-place OS upgrade, which is an unsupported
upgrade path.

[1] https://discuss.linuxcontainers.org/t/lxc-2-1-has-been-released/487

Change-Id: I9f30339210827f90818ea6993d90ca68c17fd3b2
'}, {'created': '2018-08-12 08:16:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add lxc3 compatibility

lxc3 deprecates many legacy config keys [1].

This change ensures that containers created on systems with lxc3
use the appropriate apparmor config keys. At this point we do not
need to address lxc2->lxc3 upgrades as these would only occur
during a Xenial->Bionic in-place OS upgrade, which is an unsupported
upgrade path.

[1] https://discuss.linuxcontainers.org/t/lxc-2-1-has-been-released/487

Change-Id: I9f30339210827f90818ea6993d90ca68c17fd3b2
'}]
commit_message:
Add lxc3 compatibility

lxc3 deprecates many legacy config keys [1].

This change ensures that containers created on systems with lxc3
use the appropriate apparmor config keys. At this point we do not
need to address lxc2->lxc3 upgrades as these would only occur
during a Xenial->Bionic in-place OS upgrade, which is an unsupported
upgrade path.

[1] https://discuss.linuxcontainers.org/t/lxc-2-1-has-been-released/487

Change-Id: I9f30339210827f90818ea6993d90ca68c17fd3b2

Import fuxi specific jobs

project, import them here following Zuul best practices.

Update zuul.yaml with jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-09 03:08:33.000000000', 'message': 'import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

[{'account_id': 27086, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-09-11 09:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-11 09:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-09-11 09:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We promote the distro_install jobs, given that they are
   all now working.

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We promote the centos-7 distro_install job, given that it
   is now working.

Change-Id: I39058d02fabcc2801f3d3a8a5ac910668ad5c1f5

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/592243/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 31m 59s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-16 14:13:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We support multiple aliases today by specifying the 'alias' key multiple times, right?

 [pci]
 alias = { ... }
 alias = { ... }

Supporting list format in a single value might be a desirable fix except that we're pretty dedicated to not spending any more dev/reviewer resources on the legacy PCI subsystem. We're instead moving toward replacing it with a placement-based device passthrough model (see [1]).

So if it's true that you can specify multiple alias keys as described above, I think we should simply resolve this bug by adding that as an example to the doc for the conf option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591037/"}, {'account_id': 25284, 'date': '2018-08-17 01:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-08-17 01:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add an example to add more pci devices in nova.conf

The help for the [pci]aliases config option was confusing in that it
wasn't clear how to specify multiple aliases. The default value being []
made it seem like you ought to be able to specify a list as:

 alias = [{...}, {...}, ...]

This won't actually work; you instead have to say:

 alias = {...}
 alias = {...}
 ...

So this patch adds a multi-alias example to the help string and
explicitly calls out the fact that you can't use list values.

See the referenced bug for more details.
Change-Id: I71d4c440340db31d22a73a8b3e3abc51771aa7bc
Closes-Bug: #1786870

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I7ab4a3e6826f64225f1909a1b36e64fc186b53ed
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

messages:
[{'account_id': 26165, 'date': '2018-08-28 11:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26165, 'date': '2018-08-28 11:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2018-08-28 11:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This seems like something you can compute on your own on the timeseries database or whatever tool you use, no?'}, {'account_id': 15843, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* ipmi-test http://52.27.155.124/ipmi/597054/1 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 15843, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

* ipmi-test http://52.27.155.124/ipmi/597054/2 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 26165, 'date': '2018-09-11 06:57:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Because the resource of gnocchi instance does'n have attribute about memory avalable size,
so it can not only use memory.usage in measure to divide memory avalable size to get 
memory utilization when getting measure of memory.usage size.
It is suggested that adding memory utilization metric which is convenient and don't 
need to edit a lot of code."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So just add a memory available metric?'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-09-11 09:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}]

Ceilometer-compute-agent collects metric memory.usage for memory

may be less usefull in most application scenaria when comprerad
to memory.util. It is suggested to add memory utilization metric

are created with different nova flavor quota. So memory.usage

commit_message:
Add memory utilization metric

Ceilometer-compute-agent collects metric memory.usage for memory
type metric of nova instances by default, but those instances
are created with different nova flavor quota. So memory.usage
may be less usefull in most application scenaria when comprerad
to memory.util. It is suggested to add memory utilization meter
which uses percentage represents memory utilization status.

Change-Id: I86c4dc17a562b22b1f2bc650840aa6809d02c02c

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-09-04 08:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-09-04 10:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-09-04 17:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-09-05 09:49:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

unfortunately you can't install the systemd file from two different packages. either put it only in one (like e.g the pyhton3 variant) or split it into a -common package that both depend on."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:17:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> unfortunately you can't install the systemd file from two different packages. either put it only in one (like e.g the pyhton3 variant) or split it into a -common package that both depend on.

I look through the existing specs and can't find anything similar to that conditional build/install thing. Any pointers please?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-09-10 23:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-09-10 23:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-09-11 07:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-08-31 02:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-31 02:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2018-09-03 01:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:36:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This blueprint depends many thirty libraries such as java, sysbench, rabbitmq-perf-test tool,...'}]

subject: Introduce proper diver mapping in VIF handler
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 14885, 'name': 'Daniel Mellado', 'email': 'dmellado@redhat.com', 'username': 'daniel-mellado'}, {'_account_id': 21747, 'name': 'Peng Liu', 'email': 'pliu@redhat.com', 'username': 'pliu'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}, {'_account_id': 24604, 'name': 'Danil Golov', 'email': 'd.golov@samsung.com', 'username': 'd.golov'}, {'_account_id': 25900, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuramshin', 'email': 'vladimir@kuramsh.in', 'username': 'vkuramshin'}, {'_account_id': 28082, 'name': 'Yash Gupta', 'email': 'y.gupta@samsung.com', 'username': 'y.gupta'}, {'_account_id': 28396, 'name': 'Alexey Perevalov', 'email': 'alexey.perevalov@huawei.com', 'username': 'a.perevalov'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-13 11:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-15 07:39:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-08-16 07:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It looks like you are trying to implement a dynamic vif&vif-driver registration mechanism, so that vifs can be deleted with correct vif-driver. 
However, it seems a little over-kill. Why not just define a statistic map for that, I think the mapping between vif object type and vif-driver is one-to-one. The code will be much conciser in this way.'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-16 10:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Peng, thanks for comment,
so you suggest to keep hardcoded or predefined in config file the mapping e.g.
VIFOpenVSwitch:NeutronPodVIFDriver,VIFSriov:SriovVIFDriver
From my point of view maintainability of this approach is lesser than in approach where you set pod vif driver in runtime in pod vif driver, but it depends how often new pod vif drivers will appear. Lets wait for another opinion ;) current vote selection:
 1) keep it statically
 2) populate dynamically'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-17 13:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-21 12:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-08-26 07:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

few nits, otherwise good to go'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-27 10:32:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-08-27 10:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-29 04:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-08-29 07:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

among all possible solutions:
1. keep state of  vif->podvif driver in persistent storage and populate it dynamicly (save to file)
   a. file
   b. reread pods for current node and recreate that map(but yes it looks like over engineering)
2. hard code it in VIFHandler

Now I think to choose 2.

And rely on following claim: every pod vif driver operates with unique  VIF type. Currently it's true."}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-08-29 07:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-08-29 07:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-08-31 14:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-03 06:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

This is breaking port pool support, as it is not using the multipool driver to return the ports to the pool (in case it is enabled)'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-09-04 13:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-05 07:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

just a couple of nits'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-09-05 07:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Thanks! It looks good to me!'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-09-06 11:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-09-07 07:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-09-11 07:43:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> > What happens if VIFs from a single class are allocated by different
 > > vif-drivers?
 > > 
 > > For example, nested-sriov and regular nested-vlan might use the
 > > same kuryr_kubernetes.objects.VIFVlanNested() ..
 > > 
 > I think using just the name of vif object's class is not sufficient
 > to handle all cases.
 > we though about uniqueness, and we found for each pod vif driver
 > unique VIF type. Even in nested DPDK support new VIF type was
 > introduced. SRIOV pod vif driver introduces new VIF type as well.

So in future if a new vif driver is introduced which reuses some VIF Objects, 
we will not be able to determine which vif driver to use. 

A simple use-case would be extending the neutron-vif driver to use 
pre-created ports from a given port_id in annotation. 
Do you suggest we make duplicate VIF classes for VIFOpenVSwitch and VIFBridge,
and then handle them appropriately in CNI binding driver as well?"}, {'account_id': 28396, 'date': '2018-09-11 08:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> > > What happens if VIFs from a single class are allocated by
 > different
 > > > vif-drivers?
 > > >
 > > > For example, nested-sriov and regular nested-vlan might use the
 > > > same kuryr_kubernetes.objects.VIFVlanNested() ..
 > > >
 > > I think using just the name of vif object's class is not
 > sufficient
 > > to handle all cases.
 > > we though about uniqueness, and we found for each pod vif driver
 > > unique VIF type. Even in nested DPDK support new VIF type was
 > > introduced. SRIOV pod vif driver introduces new VIF type as well.
 > 
 > So in future if a new vif driver is introduced which reuses some
 > VIF Objects,
 > we will not be able to determine which vif driver to use.
 > 
 > A simple use-case would be extending the neutron-vif driver to use
 > pre-created ports from a given port_id in annotation.
 > Do you suggest we make duplicate VIF classes for VIFOpenVSwitch and
 > VIFBridge,
 > and then handle them appropriately in CNI binding driver as well?

I doesn't exclude when kuryr-k8s will have such use case e.g. precreated port more complex solution will be required, like as storing vif->id - pod vif driver map in kubernetes."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 11:08:39.000000000', 'message': "Introduce VIFRegistry

This abstract class provides interface to register
vif -> pod vif driver matching. It's necessary for calling method of
appropriate pod vif driver in VIFHandler when handler knows only
vif.

This version doen't introduce mandatory requirement for multi vif driver
to work with VIFRegistry. Any multi vif should check whether vifregistry
was assigned or not.

Change-Id: I8ad841f088b649ba5663005216bbbe5d78f26616
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Introduce proper diver mapping in VIF handler

This commit adds hard-coded mapping in format:
<name of vif object type>:<alias of pod vif driver>.
Thus all the functions (such as activate and release)
in MultiVIFPool class can use proper driver for exact vif.

Target bp: pod-vif-driver-by-vif-lookup-problem
Change-Id: I8ad841f088b649ba5663005216bbbe5d78f26616
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id7537b135a4b6a403c754acd468784ddf395263d
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-10 09:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-09-10 09:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-10 11:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

WORKS! The last piece of the puzzle for restoring the updates job :)

From zuul:

tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates -- success (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-10 16:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-10 21:24:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Rather than move prepare back to the plan_management workflow, can we just add prepare to any workflow which does a stack update? I think this means we only need to add it to package_update.yaml.

The reason prepare doesn't belong in plan management is that it can take a long time due to do the image transfers and image building, and the code which waits for the plan_management workflow to finish expects it to run fast, so it times out with an error.

Whereas, the deployment workflow *is* expected to take a long time, so doing prepare there works just fine.

I'll come up with an alternative to this change just to show what I mean."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-10 21:32:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Here is what I was thinking.

I should clarify, the prepare action does not do image transfers or building (that happens later during the stack update) but the action does do a skopeo inspect on every image, which can take some time depending on the responsiveness of the image registry.

Here is the change I'm proposing as an alternative approach  to this change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601430/"}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-09-11 03:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-11 06:53:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Steve, let's go with your patch and i'll slightly amend it (fix the description of the workflow and add a depends-on to test it fully)."}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-11 06:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 09:13:54.000000000', 'message': "Set correct container image URLs during update/upgrade

We started generating container image parameters from
ContainerImagePrepare stack parameter. However, this processing was
done in deployment workflow, and as such it was used only when the
full deployment was performed, it was skipped during updates and
upgrades, resulting in ContainerImagePrepare parameter being
effectively ignored, and the conainter image URLs pointing to their
default locations.

To correctly process the ContainerImagePrepare parameter every time
we're updating the deployment plan, we should move the logic from
deployment workflow to plan_management workflows. These are used on
deploy, update, and upgrade, and should contain such common logic.

Change-Id: I882c2245424739b90283a2f5576f62ced94c4f9f
Partial-Bug: #1791332
"}, {'created': '2018-09-10 09:20:55.000000000', 'message': "Set correct container image URLs during update/upgrade

upgrades, resulting in ContainerImagePrepare parameter being
effectively ignored, and the conainter image URLs pointing to their
default locations.

To correctly process the ContainerImagePrepare parameter every time
we're updating the deployment plan, we should move the logic from
deployment workflow to plan_management workflows. These are used on
deploy, update, and upgrade, and should contain such common logic.

Partial-Bug: #1791332
Change-Id: I882c2245424739b90283a2f5576f62ced94c4f9f
Depends-On: I9bd21b67a9bf9254458351e8ba784ed66f9949f4

commit_message:
Set correct container image URLs during update/upgrade

We started generating container image parameters from
ContainerImagePrepare stack parameter. However, this processing was
done in deployment workflow, and as such it was used only when the
full deployment was performed, it was skipped during updates and
upgrades, resulting in ContainerImagePrepare parameter being
effectively ignored, and the conainter image URLs pointing to their
default locations.

To correctly process the ContainerImagePrepare parameter every time
we're updating the deployment plan, we should move the logic from
deployment workflow to plan_management workflows. These are used on
deploy, update, and upgrade, and should contain such common logic.

Partial-Bug: #1791332
Change-Id: I882c2245424739b90283a2f5576f62ced94c4f9f
Depends-On: I9bd21b67a9bf9254458351e8ba784ed66f9949f4

commit_message:
Disable SSH connection reuse.

It could be some of the test cases failures has been caused by
change I3a70131f03aea342c8e8a04038000bd974cca921. This disable
SSH client reuse to see if it solves the problem.

Change-Id: I56fe2154d11b6d3f09f95c417e36420575918238

commit_message:
Avoid SELinux issues with the "cp -a" command

In container, "cp -a" should be avoided, especially when we copy a
volume content to the container FS with an active SELinux.

The "-a" option of "cp" is a shortcut for "-dR --preserve=all". In this
precise context, we can drop the "--preserve=all", as files are owned
by root anyway.

Change-Id: I903f340a53561ea3612462a4cd277fc97e93a37a

commit_message:
Prepare to support python3.6

This patch prepares python3.6 support.

- Add py36-local into tox.ini
- Add py36 job as non-voting.
- Support any python3.x on postinstall in package.json and karma.conf

We should add py36-local into tox.ini and support for python3.6
into setup.cfg when we decide to support python3.6 formally.

Change-Id: Ia4d7ed7fc2a7843beb532302e4ed4b856bcc6195

commit_message:
Add check.yml for prometheus and vitrage

Without this, kolla-ansible check fails with the following error:

Unable to retrieve file contents
Could not find or access '/path/to/kolla-ansible/ansible/check.yml'"}

Also adds the check command to the CI tests, to ensure that it does not
break again.

Change-Id: I9fc2f9999f55cb742ac3ac38579dcf26524a9fc7
Closes-Bug: #1790653
(cherry picked from commit 354894e2e9ca887d04a18d2843cd0492d9981e4a)

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:

commit_message:
Download binaries more securely

Obtain binaries from encrypted source when we're unable to check for
their signatures. This should provide better security than downloading
the files over HTTP but does not replace signature verification or file
integrity check.

Related-Bug: #1791674
Change-Id: I7d6eed9ab14ceb130ea4f5f03d893ddaaa0a7acd

commit_message:
Don't unmount device twice

On deleting a container with auto-removed cinder volume, the method
'_unmount_device' is called twice. The second call will fail because
the device is already unmounted and the directory is deleted.
This commit fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1791469
Change-Id: If94b0fb52e0dd6766941fc76a4690b5ec33c0a37

commit_message:
Remove post_as_copy deprecated warning from copy middleware

Almost one year has passed since all post_as_copy related code
removed by [1], we don't have to keep the warning message for
post_as_copy setting anymore in the code tree.

subject: Fix a docker internal error on server restart
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-09-07 04:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-09-10 12:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21428, 'date': '2018-09-11 02:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-07 04:18:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix a docker internal error on server restart

Zun creates docker network by passing the subnetpool and subnet
to kuryr-libnetwork. However, kuryr-libnetwork has an issue on
unseting neutron ports if a subnetpool is passed.
This commit avoid passing subnetpool when creating the docker
network.

Note: we passed subnetpool to kuryr in before because
kuryr doesn't take subnet as an input at that time so
we pass subnetpool for kuryr to search for the subnet.
Right now, kuryr support directly taking subnet as input so
subnetpool is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I5a6ef58cd109749a4aac7e6295e0f6d737918ac0
Closes-Bug: #1791041
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a docker internal error on server restart

Zun creates docker network by passing the subnetpool and subnet
to kuryr-libnetwork. However, kuryr-libnetwork has an issue on
unseting neutron ports if a subnetpool is passed.
This commit avoid passing subnetpool when creating the docker
network.

Note: we passed subnetpool to kuryr in before because
kuryr doesn't take subnet as an input at that time so
we pass subnetpool for kuryr to search for the subnet.
Right now, kuryr support directly taking subnet as input so
subnetpool is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I5a6ef58cd109749a4aac7e6295e0f6d737918ac0
Closes-Bug: #1791041

commit_message:
Fix group availability zone-backend host mismatch

Group availability zone is not set correctly in scheduler filter
properties which results in group availability zone-backend host
mismatch. This can lead to volume create failure for volumes in
the group. Fixing it by setting the availability zone in the
request spec in scheduler RPC call.

Change-Id: Icfa437d2d81ed29d0aceee776d86e28862c85274
Closes-bug: 1773446

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-16 20:01:31.000000000', 'message': 'Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Filenames of test modules need to start with test_*
so that Django test runner detects them.
There is no test defined but it would be nice to adjust the filename.

Change-Id: I794e10b2c3c2c7004f7b58ff8c8904d4537a23d9

This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Filenames of test modules need to start with test_*
so that Django test runner detects them.
There is no test defined but it would be nice to adjust the filename.

Change-Id: I794e10b2c3c2c7004f7b58ff8c8904d4537a23d9
'}]
commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Filenames of test modules need to start with test_*
so that Django test runner detects them.
There is no test defined but it would be nice to adjust the filename.

Change-Id: I794e10b2c3c2c7004f7b58ff8c8904d4537a23d9

[{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 00:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 00:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Waiting to set Storyboard IDs.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Need to confirm about storyboard URL.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Right now, storyboard attribute needs integer not text.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm of the opinion we should support project names for storyboard linking now that those are usable in webclient URLs. According to https://storyboard.openstack.org/api/v1/projects/openstack/searchlight the numeric ID of openstack/searchlight is 1059 but this is increasingly hard to find in the webclient now that it uses project names instead of ids for its URLs by default.

I've proposed I9da97a1af40bb3527c1c7e8a66a267c76b9db564 to update the validate tool in order to support both project names and integer ids."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Jeremy.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-10 04:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-09-10 06:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-10 06:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Tony. Thanks for your comment. It makes sense that I should include the pypi link even though the current deployment model does not use pip to install the Searchlight dashboard.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-11 00:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-11 00:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Thank Tony. commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-cover template

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Remove jobs and use template instead.

Change-Id: I251086151a23c78f99f39d55b4db36d1db5bc9a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 14:11:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove ironic inspector dnsmasq bind-interfaces setting

In order to allow the ironic inspector dnsmasq service to
receive packets after the network service is restarted, the
bind-interfaces option should not be set.  Since the
ironic inspector is bound to the br-ctlplane interface,
its not necessary to set this field as this dnsmasq instance
will only service this interface.

From the dnsmasq man page (http://www.thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html).
-z, --bind-interfaces
On systems which support it, dnsmasq binds the wildcard address, even when it is listening on only some interfaces. It then discards requests that it shouldn't reply to. This has the advantage of working even when interfaces come and go and change address. This option forces dnsmasq to really bind only the interfaces it is listening on. About the only time when this is useful is when running another nameserver (or another instance of dnsmasq) on the same machine. Setting this option also enables multiple instances of dnsmasq which provide DHCP service to run in the same machine.

We do run another dnsmasq instance for neutron but that is bound to the tap interface in the namespace.

Change-Id: I88a0b67a61944565e59f245f02f7e4620f92ec82

We do run another dnsmasq instance for neutron but that is bound to

Change-Id: I88a0b67a61944565e59f245f02f7e4620f92ec82
"}, {'created': '2018-09-07 08:10:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove ironic inspector dnsmasq bind-interfaces setting

commit_message:
Remove ironic inspector dnsmasq bind-interfaces setting

In order to allow the ironic inspector dnsmasq service to
receive packets after the network service is restarted, the
bind-interfaces option should not be set.  Since the
ironic inspector is bound to the br-ctlplane interface,
its not necessary to set this field as this dnsmasq instance
will only service this interface.

From the dnsmasq man page (http://www.thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html).
-z, --bind-interfaces
On systems which support it, dnsmasq binds the wildcard address,
even when it is listening on only some interfaces. It then
discards requests that it shouldn't reply to. This has the
advantage of working even when interfaces come and go and
change address. This option forces dnsmasq to really bind only
the interfaces it is listening on. About the only time when
this is useful is when running another nameserver (or another
instance of dnsmasq) on the same machine. Setting this option
also enables multiple instances of dnsmasq which provide DHCP
service to run in the same machine.

We do run another dnsmasq instance for neutron but that is bound to
the tap interface in the namespace.

Change-Id: I88a0b67a61944565e59f245f02f7e4620f92ec82

commit_message:
zun: remove the handling of not acceptable error

This is for addressing outstanding comments in
I4ef36a3c4a805b3e041fcb9456c297e59865485c . The handling of not
acceptable error is for being compatible with legacy deployment
but this requirement is an expectation so we remove it.

Change-Id: I52c6dbc89ef9a00680bd9dc5e2e1ee5f2ce49f10

This patch suggest to replace current one with oslo_messaging.

commit_message:
Use Swift's in-tree DSVM test

While we're at it, make a new job that inherits from it to bring the
legacy-swiftclient-dsvm-functional testing in-tree, too.

For naming, follow naming policy and remove "dsvm" from names.

Remove legacy jobs, they are not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I919c0b77ac4888350194f55a9c12e0742845024f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589270

commit_message:
remove legacy-swift-dsvm-functional jobs

The new job swift-dsvm-functional replaces job
legacy-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only.

Remove legacy-swift-dsvm-functional, we do not install with Identity v2
since queens.

Change-Id: I8b353cba66b22de42ae42954ec44e5802224fc23

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I55e36398f51acc1d9faf546101e2a4dffa7277ce
Story: #2002586
Task: #24304

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 08:54:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gateway's router port marked as DOWN

This patch is fixing a problem which left the external/gateway's router
port with status DOWN even after the port was bound to a chassis.

Since the Logical_Router_Port table in OVNNB does not have a "up" column
(like the Logical_Switch_Port table has) the status of those ports can
not be updpated based on it. Therefore, this patch uses the "chassis"
column for that. If the router port has the "chassis" column in OVNNB
database set, the binding and status ACTIVE will be set in Neutron
otherwise it status will be udpated to DOWN (if it's not DOWN yet).

Closes-Bug: #1715126
Change-Id: I91026204eae6df18be47df02f99db2f95c428e2b
(cherry picked from commit 3d575d19b850134044bba8b89cdb9953c17a5ca7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gateway's router port marked as DOWN

This patch is fixing a problem which left the external/gateway's router
port with status DOWN even after the port was bound to a chassis.

Since the Logical_Router_Port table in OVNNB does not have a "up" column
(like the Logical_Switch_Port table has) the status of those ports can
not be updpated based on it. Therefore, this patch uses the "chassis"
column for that. If the router port has the "chassis" column in OVNNB
database set, the binding and status ACTIVE will be set in Neutron
otherwise it status will be udpated to DOWN (if it's not DOWN yet).

Closes-Bug: #1715126
Change-Id: I91026204eae6df18be47df02f99db2f95c428e2b
(cherry picked from commit 3d575d19b850134044bba8b89cdb9953c17a5ca7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 21:36:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use unicode for debug string

On Python2, the "line" variable here is a unicode string, but the
LOG.debug statement is trying to format it with a bytes string; this
leads to a conversion error when the line has unicode characters in
it.  Ensure the logging format string is a unicode object to avoid
this.

Change-Id: I9948ffcea3fd10c4b6695593fa2a42731b44c02f
'}]
commit_message:
Use unicode for debug string

On Python2, the "line" variable here is a unicode string, but the
LOG.debug statement is trying to format it with a bytes string; this
leads to a conversion error when the line has unicode characters in
it.  Ensure the logging format string is a unicode object to avoid
this.

Change-Id: I9948ffcea3fd10c4b6695593fa2a42731b44c02f

messages:
[{'account_id': 27462, 'date': '2018-08-22 08:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-22 08:58:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Node poll URL improvements

* Add POLL_URL_CONN_ERROR_AS_UNHEALTHY and have default be True
* Treat URL connection errors as indication of unhealthy node if
  POLL_URL_CONN_ERROR_AS_UNHEALTHY is True.

Change-Id: Ie5ba87feccf0073bdf64c82a8717d7799e448201

subject: update test section about requiring chromium
messages:
[{'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-09 19:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27861, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:51:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good.
Do we also need to mention to set path at process.env.CHROME_BIN if required?
I need to set process.env.CHROME_BIN = '/usr/bin/chromium' at https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/master/test/karma.conf.js on SUSE Leap OS."}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:54:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Looks good.
 > Do we also need to mention to set path at process.env.CHROME_BIN if
 > required?
 > I need to set process.env.CHROME_BIN = '/usr/bin/chromium' at
 > https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/master/test/karma.conf.js
 > on SUSE Leap OS.

Yeah that's a good point, I only test on ubuntu 16.04 so I will make an edit to add a note for other OS's that setting CHROME_BIN in that file may be required."}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27861, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-09-10 22:11:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM and +A because this is a good doc improvement for developers, and there's no reason to prevent."}]

commit_message:
update test section about requiring chromium

when running npm test and npm run unit without the chromium-browser
package installed, the tests fail to run[1]. This commit aims to make
the requirement for this package clear to testers.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/727761/
Change-Id: I5685af1160321378829df27f31c0da1724d263ab

subject: Correct severe performance problem
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-09-10 18:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-09-10 20:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\ncombines backport of the fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582358/ ... lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 7414, 'date': '2018-09-10 21:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 18:05:23.000000000', 'message': "Correct severe performance problem

When running our plugins we're seeing a severe performance impact in
the ansible run-time. As it turns out, within the linear strategy we're
looping over all physical hosts in an environment and pulling address
information out to store as a task variable. This action causes all
tasks to reload all {group,host}_vars for all hosts and that repetitive
action results in a massive slowdown, especially when there are many
hosts within the inventory.

Results from a normal OSA playbook run on 50 hosts:
  time openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml --forks 15
  real    37m44.263s
  user    35m30.984s
  sys     2m23.252s

Results with the strategy plugin disabled on 50 hosts:
  time ANSIBLE_STRATEGY_PLUGINS=false openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml --forks 15
  real    5m8.641s
  user    6m30.792s
  sys     1m32.512s

This change scopes the physical host look up to the task and target host
and adds conditionals around the process to ensure we're not forcing a lookup
that has no chance of succeeding.

Results with this patch applied on 50 hosts and no forks:
  time openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml
  real    6m40.573s
  user    7m53.336s
  sys     1m25.828s

Should anything like this come up again debug statements have been added
to the method so that we can enable verbose mode and know what is being
parsed.

Change-Id: I76af71ffe19b2a8afb18ed731f1362a4e399c613
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 785d32be7107ab1744670183d7cad27cf62b2ae7)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Correct severe performance problem

When running our plugins we're seeing a severe performance impact in
the ansible run-time. As it turns out, within the linear strategy we're
looping over all physical hosts in an environment and pulling address
information out to store as a task variable. This action causes all
tasks to reload all {group,host}_vars for all hosts and that repetitive
action results in a massive slowdown, especially when there are many
hosts within the inventory.

Results from a normal OSA playbook run on 50 hosts:
  time openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml --forks 15
  real    37m44.263s
  user    35m30.984s
  sys     2m23.252s

Results with the strategy plugin disabled on 50 hosts:
  time ANSIBLE_STRATEGY_PLUGINS=false openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml --forks 15
  real    5m8.641s
  user    6m30.792s
  sys     1m32.512s

This change scopes the physical host look up to the task and target host
and adds conditionals around the process to ensure we're not forcing a lookup
that has no chance of succeeding.

Results with this patch applied on 50 hosts and no forks:
  time openstack-ansible openstack-hosts-setup.yml
  real    6m40.573s
  user    7m53.336s
  sys     1m25.828s

Should anything like this come up again debug statements have been added
to the method so that we can enable verbose mode and know what is being
parsed.

Change-Id: I76af71ffe19b2a8afb18ed731f1362a4e399c613
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 785d32be7107ab1744670183d7cad27cf62b2ae7)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
