commit_message:
Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

NOTE: This also squashes I706199109a3b7dd5339c90b731f8cb8f04ca4f49

Closes-Bug: #1752897
Closes-Bug: #1790118
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f01169b405bb5080a1bc1653f79512eb0664c35d)

still -1 on this untill we can test ovn,odl and dragonflow wont be broken by this change.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-21 21:02:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> still -1 on this untill we can test ovn,odl and dragonflow wont be
 > broken by this change.

You're right Sean. I did follow-up DNM patch to test that: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/594153/

It looks that for ovn it's fine. For dragonflow and odl I will investigate"}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-08-21 22:08:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

comment on ODL.

This patch breaks ODL and networking-odl because ODL (netvirt) handles openflow rules in totally different way. vlan tag isn't used. and doesn't touch vlan tag at all.
ODL netvirt utilizes registers to track which tenant network packets belong to.
this patch is very specific to ovs-agent implementation. (ovn happens to be compatible with it, though.)

For short term, can this behaviour optional/configurable? Then, for ODL this behavior can be disabled.

For long term, clear contract between of-vif and backend SDN controllers should be defined (and documented). VLAN TAG seems somewhat weird because vlan may or may not be utilized."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-08-21 22:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

supplement: midonet folks also would like to see this.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-22 10:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

well in terms of clear contract i think the existing contract was that os-vif would handel l1 connectivity only and the rest was up to neutron.

the exsiting behavior is not quite that clear cut but
this change would be making os-vif handle l2 configuration of the ovs port which was previously owned entirly by neutron. as such i think we should only do that in the general case if requested to by neutron in the vif:binding-details.

i had originally considered marking this bug as wontfix for os-vif for a few reasons. i have held off on that as i would accept a solution that worked for all backends. 
The only way to make this configurable in the sort term is to introduce an os-vif config option e.g. "ovs_use_dead_vlan" which should default to false. we can have a seperate patch to devstack to override this default for the gate but we should not be enabled by default. 

if you refactor with the config option ill remove my -2 but this would break to many people to merge as is. can you also change the commit to Partial-Bug as a different solution would be needed for non ml2/ovs backends.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-22 12:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

doing some more testing this code does not break ovn.

that is not a good thing as it does not break ovn because
this code is not executed when  hybrid plug is false.
my guess is it broke odl beacuse isaku was presumable testing
with iptables i.e. hybrid plug true or vhost-user.

for ovn and now also ml2/ovs as the contrack ovs firewall driver is now the enabled by default instead of ip tables, hybrid plug is set to false by default. in that configuration os-vif only ensures the the bridge exists https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/vif_plug_ovs/ovs.py#L216-L221 and the plugin is actually done by libvirt/the hyperviosr.

now i personally would prefer if libvirt did not plug the vif in this case and also delegate this configuration to os-vif also in the future but that require nova virt driver changes. so even with ml2 ovs this will not work unless you use the iptables firewall driver in neutron.

we could try precreating the ovs port in non hybrid plug case but im not sure if that will break libvirt or not. As it stands this is an incomplete solution that i think needs more thought and testing give to the different consomers/edgecases before proceeding with.'}, {'account_id': 16278, 'date': '2018-08-31 10:22:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

4095 (DEAD_VLAN_TAG) is actually a shared VLAN. Instances from different projects can put a port down and communicate with each other over this port. 

For this reason, a drop flow should also be installed.

This is mentioned in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ossa/+bug/1734320 as issue #4.'}, {'account_id': 28870, 'date': '2018-09-04 08:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Gerhard pointed it out already: a drop flow should also be installed.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-10 13:28:50.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

That isn't good approach for sure. We will have to find something better"}]

commit_message:
Avoid os-vif to add untagged ports to ovs ports by default

When new port is created in OVS it will now be tagged
with 4095 (DEAD_VLAN_TAG) by default.
Because of that such port will not work as trunk port and
will not be able to get traffic from other networks on same
host.
Neutron-openvswitch-agent will remove this DEAD_VLAN_TAG and
configure proper vlan_id for such port in its normal wiring
process.

Change-Id: I3d3a0a6492bd83ef83862b100dd96bafed960a25
Closes-Bug: #1734320

commit_message:
Remove bundled intree tempest plugin

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530454/ moves the
  monasca_log_api tempest plugin to monasca tempest plugin
  Let's consume it.

* Moved contrib to root folder and removed dummy pre_test_hook.sh

Change-Id: I1a73fdf0d10045326dc9ca09fd1c9b485a420089

commit_message:
Add Network Policy tests

This commit adds a new class and test for Network Policy.
The initial test creates a network policy, ensures kuryr creates a
KuryrNetPolicy CRD, security group and then tears them down.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583540/
Change-Id: Ifb98e721996ee1800e71089cf252e4d62f88470f

messages:
[{'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-03-20 21:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-20 21:54:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11878, 'date': '2018-03-21 05:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I think that the design would be much cleaner if you defined a custom ResourceClass for each specific class of device/function that is being offered, rather than having one custom RC for everything and then differentiating with traits. This is similar to the Ironic case, where every different hardware combination is a different custom RC. In other words, instead of having every possible FPGA offering be represented with the resource class 'CUSTOM_ACCELERATOR_FPGA', with each individual type distinguished by different traits, create a custom RC for each of those individual types. Then the request is simplified, as it just filters on providers with that specific class of inventory."}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-05-16 17:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Specification for Cyborg/Nova interaction for scheduling.

Addresses issues of representing accelerators in Cyborg for
alignment with Nova, and integrating Cyborg into Nova
scheduler flow.

Change-Id: Ied10c0c9515ac498d374ffa36cf41974adf2381f
Proposes: spec cyborg-nova-scheduling
Signed-off-by: Sundar Nadathur <ns1.sundar@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support cinder api v3 and make it as the default version

Cinder already support api version 3, but rally is still not use v3 to
test, this patch is to make rally can test with v3 for cinder

Co-Authored-By: chenhb <chen.haibing1@zte.com.cn>

Change-Id: Ifcf9f3a33fe956cff6953aa5e2bdd43c0e18f027

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I9169d41d790ae874af29c8ceccf0c55ab0df7727
Story: #2002586
Task: #24327

commit_message:
Add nodejs nonvoting jobs project templates

In Searchlight UI we sometimes encounter nodejs tests that failed
because of browser incompatible and the thing is Searchlight UI
is running an old version of angularjs. This template helps us
to bypass the test.

Change-Id: I7ac261cc31a5f7222121f2221d1a71e2ee8d6891
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove Searchlight projects template

Zuul jobs for Searchlight projects were moved to repos
[1],[2],[3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601234/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601232/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601210/

commit_message:
Insert break lines when showing FFWD upgrade operator warning.

This is a simple patch to display properly the
warning text for operators when running the FFWD.
Also, rephrases the warning message as FFWD are
now fully tested.

Resolves: rhbz#1566294
Closes-Bug: 1785829
Change-Id: I0174a075e82d41ee9eacb4bdf0b4ba70cfae1007

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I36d605e1bcb17bffd0effcf3018e87ba6c1a0865
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I87aee32e930d1d2abe93f6b79cc4dc20e01dcd1b
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I87aee32e930d1d2abe93f6b79cc4dc20e01dcd1b

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Story: #2002586
Task: #24325

commit_message:
Don't set compare_host_packages:True

Now that the undercloud is containerized, there will be very few host
packages to compare to, so there is a high risk that required package
updates will be skipped.

This is a strategy inherited from container-update.py that was
intended to avoid unnecessary calls to yum update, however we now have
a better approach using the repoquery, so host package comparison is
no longer required, and probably causing some of the instances of bug

This strategy is removed from the role in change Iab7b9d6377494001d904bb84b058ea293d73110c

Change-Id: I3bb0ba1f56daf475b7498283a5b7e6dcd1540e7d
Partial-Bug: #1786764

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

commit_message:
Prevent resource deletion in Live Lab

The tempest utility that is configured here will take a snapshot.
After the snapashot and test run it will delete any resources that
are not in the snapshot.

If a tenant creates a resource outside of the test run it will also
be deleted.

This is something which is not desirable in a live lab.

This patch aims to provide control to the end-user to define how
to perform the final cleanup.

Change-Id: I1f7eb3ac5e9f9be08cb05a70bb1fb2d0f4b41382

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21486, 'name': 'wangqi', 'email': 'wang.qi@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wangqi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27078, 'name': 'Manik Bindlish', 'email': 'manikbindlish19@gmail.com', 'username': 'manik'}, {'_account_id': 27621, 'name': 'Vishakha Agarwal', 'email': 'agarwalvishakha18@gmail.com', 'username': 'Vishakha'}]

[{'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-03 06:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-03 11:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-03 13:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-tempest-dvr: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542
- openstack-tox-py35: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py36: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-py3: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-queens-py3: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-rocky-py3: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-06 10:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-09-06 10:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

LGTM!'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-06 15:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-09-07 06:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Yeah, I think it looks better but I put -1 with the following reason.

I think we don't need to replace six.iteritems(). Because, 

 1. There are 3048 six.iteritems() under openstack/ repos now. (I think it's too many.)
 2. The benefit is unclear.

If this has a significant improvement of the performance and/or making it more readable code, or something other benefits, let's merge. So, I'd like to know the benefit of this patch.

And I think the wiki[0] is just saying "we shouldn't replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems() anymore.", but not saying "we should replace six.iteritems() with dict.items()."

What do you think?

And, I think this patch is similar to this patch[1].

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483816/'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-09-07 06:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

ditto'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-10 11:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use items() instead of iteritems()

Replacing six.iteritems(d), which has been removed
in python 3 [1]. This replaces that with d.items().
Also refrencing [2].

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/Python3.0#Built-In_Changes
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ibd29eafefe3e447abc7689a12f4ed79e7f761993

[{'created': '2018-09-10 07:47:04.000000000', 'message': 'use stestr for os-brick

Also, we are seeing random CI failures due to concurrency. Stestr is
running in parallel by default. See

https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#parallel-testing

This is problematic for time sensitive tests such as this one

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/tests/
privileged/test_rootwrap.py#L101

where the thread can be interrupted prior to final time measurement.
This may cause the test to fail randomly. Therefore, we need to
run the tests with the concurrency of 1 to avoid these kinds of
unpredictable failures.

Change-Id: I41e49dab34a92163f7ffc5951cd98a8a88ba02e0
(cherry picked from commit d6b8f41c9605a9942cfe7a61ccafbfb7461c87b2)

commit_message:
use stestr for os-brick

Also, we are seeing random CI failures due to concurrency. Stestr is
running in parallel by default. See

https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#parallel-testing

This is problematic for time sensitive tests such as this one

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/tests/
privileged/test_rootwrap.py#L101

where the thread can be interrupted prior to final time measurement.
This may cause the test to fail randomly. Therefore, we need to
run the tests with the concurrency of 1 to avoid these kinds of
unpredictable failures.

Change-Id: I41e49dab34a92163f7ffc5951cd98a8a88ba02e0
(cherry picked from commit d6b8f41c9605a9942cfe7a61ccafbfb7461c87b2)

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: I5dacc784413663fa1862d087ac4580c445558dde

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 08:49:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix the migration playbook error

The ovn_migration.yaml playbook uses the tag 'include_role'
which is not allowed. We see the below error.

This patch fixes it

ERROR! 'include_role' is not a valid attribute for a Play

The error appears to have been in '/home/stack/ovn_migration/
tripleo_environment/playbooks/ovn-migration.yml': line 76, column 3, but may
be elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.

This patch also fixes another error. When the pre migation VM is created, we
test it by running the command '/sbin/ip'. In some of the cirros images
the right path is '/bin/ip'. So change this to the comand 'date'.

Change-Id: Id8f8e2bbc71fee63f14339bc6041c04f3a177495
Closes-bug: #1788158
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the migration playbook error

The ovn_migration.yaml playbook uses the tag 'include_role'
which is not allowed. We see the below error.

This patch fixes it

ERROR! 'include_role' is not a valid attribute for a Play

The error appears to have been in '/home/stack/ovn_migration/
tripleo_environment/playbooks/ovn-migration.yml': line 76, column 3, but may
be elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.

This patch also fixes another error. When the pre migation VM is created, we
test it by running the command '/sbin/ip'. In some of the cirros images
the right path is '/bin/ip'. So change this to the comand 'date'.

Change-Id: Id8f8e2bbc71fee63f14339bc6041c04f3a177495
Closes-bug: #1788158

commit_message:
Fix API version in the manila tempest config

Manila's API is versioned, and each release
has a different version maximum that we want
to test with.

Change-Id: I51b799cd2adf2c38cb93727552ae750cc4d9bead
Closes-Bug: #1790857

commit_message:
Minor improvement of the NoopPublisher

A name is more human readable. Workflow and task always have a name.
It's convenient when you play with notifications.

Change-Id: I6fda6ea688a720605819545d2f86a1534bf1d480
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/601057
Change-Id: If703f0dcf1cb58f3bbd28bd1432ff19e68c21aad
Story: #2002586
Task: #24327

commit_message:
Add a tripleoclient container

We'd like to use this container both interactively (for
ad-hoc commands) and also to be able to generate
Ansible (via the undercloud/all-in-one installers) for TripleO.

Partially-implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/zero-footprint

Change-Id: Ia4d7fdcb9c96d76e191dcc1a46be095b37189b3e

commit_message:
tempest: temporarily disable some tests until bug 1789878 is fixed

This change temporarily disable some tempests tests until
bug 1789878 is fixed.

Note well: this is a cherry-pick with modifications.
On stable/queens, bug 1789878 prevents all scenarios
tests from succeeding, or at least reliably so. This
is why this change skips all scenario tests.

Change-Id: I67e8834c09f475b997edf9bf095fa1ac6595e4e0
Related-Bug: 1789878
(cherry-picked from 4897b5c7d0d14a84b9c44aba3fa8d88d1f2d811c)

Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: I564386a7002408700947ff657c37898fc32d26c6

subject: Revert to v3 etcd api but skip TLS verification
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-09-07 13:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-09-07 14:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-09-10 08:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-07 13:51:35.000000000', 'message': 'Revert to v3 etcd api but skip TLS verification

Using the etcd v3 api causes vault to suffer from bug
https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/issues/4961. But v2 has its own
issues *1. This patch switches back to using the v3 api but disables
vault from perfomring TLS certificate checks against the etcd
cluster. Given that the charm deployed vault only uses etcd to store
a token for HA and that token is inturn encrypted by vault it does
not seem a significant security risk.

*1 As Dmitrii Shcherbakov noted, the vault documentation
expresses reservations about the v2 api:

https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/configuration/storage/etcd.html
"the Etcd storage backend supports high availability. The v2 API has
known issues with HA support and should not be used in HA scenarios."

Change-Id: I204bcdbfbc7ed2084542fca7781f1bd802bdb77a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert to v3 etcd api but skip TLS verification

Using the etcd v3 api causes vault to suffer from bug
https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/issues/4961. But v2 has its own
issues *1. This patch switches back to using the v3 api but disables
vault from perfomring TLS certificate checks against the etcd
cluster. Given that the charm deployed vault only uses etcd to store
a token for HA and that token is inturn encrypted by vault it does
not seem a significant security risk.

*1 As Dmitrii Shcherbakov noted, the vault documentation
expresses reservations about the v2 api:

https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/configuration/storage/etcd.html
"the Etcd storage backend supports high availability. The v2 API has
known issues with HA support and should not be used in HA scenarios."

Change-Id: I204bcdbfbc7ed2084542fca7781f1bd802bdb77a

The release-notes-jobs-python3 template is setup already, remove
indvidual jobs - they are redundant.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

The repo defined both voting and non-voting openstack-lower-constraints
jobs, only use the non-voting one. Remove the extra jobs. Add comment
on why the job is non-voting.

Update requirements constraint for packages since neutron and horizon
require newer versions.

Remove openstack-tox-docs jobs with required-projects - the way the job
is setup in tox.ini together with doc/requirements.txt, we do not need
these.

Change-Id: I5fbf32b52ec6a5878761e23a5aee592e8c516bca
'}]
commit_message:
Update Zuul configuration

Instead of using openstack-tox-cover template, run the cover job
in the check queue only as the template would do.

The release-notes-jobs-python3 template is setup already, remove
indvidual jobs - they are redundant.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

The repo defined both voting and non-voting openstack-lower-constraints
jobs, only use the non-voting one. Remove the extra jobs. Add comment
on why the job is non-voting.

Update requirements constraint for packages since neutron and horizon
require newer versions.

Remove openstack-tox-docs jobs with required-projects - the way the job
is setup in tox.ini together with doc/requirements.txt, we do not need
these.

Change-Id: I5fbf32b52ec6a5878761e23a5aee592e8c516bca

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Id512c7b6a6c37128cfd6700473426b9fa56b36bb

We always run DB sync in deploy_tasks, ensuring that the database is
up to date. We should follow up with online data migrations
too.

Doing this via docker_config has 2 purposes:

* We can easily ensure this happens in a container with the right
  config files mounted.

* We can even apply this via a minor update. This is important because
  we'll have to backport this all the way to Pike and apply it there
  using Pike containers, before upgrading to Queens containers.

Change-Id: I2eb6c7c42d7e7aea4a78a892790e42bc5371f792
Closes-Bug: #1790474
"}, {'created': '2018-09-04 10:03:51.000000000', 'message': "Run online data migrations

up to date. We should follow up with online data migrations

Doing this via docker_config has 2 purposes:

  config files mounted.

* We can even apply this via a minor update. This is important because

There's an additional issue to consider: In Puppet service variant we
ran the online migrations for release X before upgrading to X+1, but
the proposed Docker variant migrations for X run with upgrade to
X. This means that when switching from non-containerized to
containerized, we'll need to run migrations twice, to correctly switch
between the aforementioned approaches.

commit_message:
Run online data migrations

We always run DB sync in deploy_tasks, ensuring that the database is
up to date. We should follow up with online data migrations
too.

Doing this via docker_config has 2 purposes:

* We can easily ensure this happens in a container with the right
  config files mounted.

* We can even apply this via a minor update. This is important because
  we'll have to backport this all the way to Pike and apply it there
  using Pike containers, before upgrading to Queens containers.

There's an additional issue to consider: In Puppet service variant we
ran the online migrations for release X before upgrading to X+1, but
the proposed Docker variant migrations for X run with upgrade to
X. This means that when switching from non-containerized to
containerized, we'll need to run migrations twice, to correctly switch
between the aforementioned approaches.

Change-Id: I2eb6c7c42d7e7aea4a78a892790e42bc5371f792
Closes-Bug: #1790474

subject: Add JJB rtd webhook id
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 13807, 'name': 'Thanh Ha', 'display_name': 'zxiiro', 'email': 'zxiiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'zxiiro', 'status': 'On Leave'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13807, 'date': '2018-09-06 22:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13807, 'date': '2018-09-06 22:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-09-06 22:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-07 05:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

why do we need this at all? JJB is published on https://docs.openstack.org/infra/jenkins-job-builder/ .

RTD is a new thing according to jobs.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-09-07 07:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hrm, yes, maybe we should just remove https://jenkins-job-builder.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ ?  it was last published over a year ago (not that i guess that is a very active repo these days)'}, {'account_id': 13807, 'date': '2018-09-07 14:39:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> hrm, yes, maybe we should just remove https://jenkins-job-builder.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
 > ?  it was last published over a year ago (not that i guess that is
 > a very active repo these days)

JJB's pretty active these days. We've been releasing bi-weekly since January.

I have no idea about the readthedocs part. I figured docs.openstack.org was just a CNAME to it but I guess not?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-07 14:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

thanh, readthedocs and docs.o.o are two different systems.

IMHO this change is not needed at all. You publish to docs.openstack.org/infra/jenkins-job-builder...'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We wanted to publish to RTD too, as the project is not really part of openstack.

We plan to run in parallel for a longer period of time before making a decision to pick one and drop the other.'}, {'account_id': 13807, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:43:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the explanations. With that I'm fine with either. I agree with Sorin too. JJB's not really part of OpenStack anymore but it doesn't bother me where the docs are hosted / generated. If it's no problem to host in both locations let's do it.

In either case the situation improves since it sounds like the readthedocs location is severely out of date and this would at least cause it to update."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-09-10 05:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

or we could remove RTD if it's so out of date?  anyway, the setup looks OK to me, so if AJaeger agrees I don't mind"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-10 07:59:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

I really don't think that having two places is beneficial but will not block, so if this is what you want to do -  let's go ahead..."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 23:08:05.000000000', 'message': 'use stestr for os-brick

Also, we are seeing random CI failures due to concurrency. Stestr is
running in parallel by default. See

https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#parallel-testing

This is problematic for time sensitive tests such as this one

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/tests/
privileged/test_rootwrap.py#L101

where the thread can be interrupted prior to final time measurement and
therefore causes the test to fail randomly.

Change-Id: I41e49dab34a92163f7ffc5951cd98a8a88ba02e0
'}, {'created': '2018-09-06 00:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'use stestr for os-brick

Also, we are seeing random CI failures due to concurrency. Stestr is
running in parallel by default. See

https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#parallel-testing

This is problematic for time sensitive tests such as this one

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/tests/
privileged/test_rootwrap.py#L101

where the thread can be interrupted prior to final time measurement.
This may cause the test to fail randomly. Therefore, we need to
run the tests with the concurrency of 1 to avoid these kinds of
unpredictable failures.

Change-Id: I41e49dab34a92163f7ffc5951cd98a8a88ba02e0
'}]
commit_message:
use stestr for os-brick

Also, we are seeing random CI failures due to concurrency. Stestr is
running in parallel by default. See

https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#parallel-testing

This is problematic for time sensitive tests such as this one

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/tests/
privileged/test_rootwrap.py#L101

where the thread can be interrupted prior to final time measurement.
This may cause the test to fail randomly. Therefore, we need to
run the tests with the concurrency of 1 to avoid these kinds of
unpredictable failures.

Change-Id: I41e49dab34a92163f7ffc5951cd98a8a88ba02e0

commit_message:
Add prometheus & grafana container image tags

To upgrade cluster we need to be able to set image tags
so this change adds to labels for corresponding containers

Task: 23314
Story: 2003171

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 28373, 'name': 'Kailun Qin', 'email': 'kailun.qin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'kailun.qin'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-06 04:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/580543/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 28m 24s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-07-09 20:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

You would also need tests'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-07-10 10:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-07-10 10:33:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

It's kind of hard to add UTs for race condition issues, especially for fixes using synchronization. Previous fixes like bug #1743579 does not associate with a UT neither.

Adding synchronized locks would only serialize the method which makes the result determined but won't produce any functional impacts. Unit/function level tests may kind of like testing the functionality of the locks.

Besides, currently it is acceptable that a race condition is found and protected against multiple bindings (handled by exception). But for cases where multi-binding is allowed (e.g. HA router etc.), they might not be handled well.

Based on the above, I'd like to discuss:
1) whether the inter-process synchronization locks are still needed if we accept the race and handle it by raising an exception.
2) if needed, which level of tests are expected.

Thanks for your comments."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-10 11:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/580543/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 26m 29s'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-07-11 00:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-11 02:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tempest-full: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-11 02:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/580543/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 42s'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-07-11 10:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-07-12 07:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-31 07:37:47.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-09-01 12:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Restored

Let's work out a better solution on this."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-09-01 14:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/580543/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 29m 54s'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-09-04 21:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-04 21:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-09-04 23:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/580543/2 : FAILURE in 1h 28m 32s'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-09-10 07:14:33.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Brian/garyk/Miguel,
Thanks for all your comments and guidance on the resolution. Personally I learnt quite a lot of things from this patch.

After checking with the production environment and doing further investigation, we found that:

1) For the L3 part, the issue reported can be mostly addressed by https://review.openstack.org/364278 and it is enough to cover our current scenarios.
2) For the DHCP agent scheduling part, we do not face further negative impacts when multiple DHCP server instances scheduled to different agents.
3) The fix we were trying to propose may cause a significant bottle-neck for large deployments when there was a large number of agents requesting networks to be scheduled. This was observed during full system recovery scenarios when the a large number of compute hosts were rebooting simultaneously. Thus it is definitely NOT a good idea to have this in neutron, as most of you've already pointed out.

Considering the cost benefit of fixing this so we support the case indicated by garyk and based on the findings/tests cited above, I'd like to abandon this patch accordingly.

Let me know if any further concern. Thanks again."}]

[{'created': '2018-07-06 02:33:34.000000000', 'message': 'Synchronize agent scheduling to prevent the race

A race condition may occur when concurrent agent scheduling happens,
since neutron-server uses multiple child processes to handle the agent
scheduling requests simultaneously.

The idea is to add inter-process synchronization locks on the top-level
scheduling operations of DHCP servers and routers to ensure the
scheduling decisions of a resource are atomic.

Closes-Bug: #1780357
Change-Id: If1fac6c2986fb8a0a5a3c0f6526bd0ceaba86d36
Signed-off-by: Kailun Qin <kailun.qin@intel.com>

commit_message:
Synchronize agent scheduling to prevent a race

A race condition may occur when concurrent agent scheduling happens,
since neutron-server uses multiple child processes to handle the agent
scheduling requests simultaneously.

The idea is to add inter-process synchronization locks on the top-level
scheduling operations of DHCP servers and routers to ensure the
scheduling decisions of a resource are atomic.

Closes-Bug: #1780357
Change-Id: If1fac6c2986fb8a0a5a3c0f6526bd0ceaba86d36

Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: I65f03adfc05134bf5ddaa802b97b80d14a0b412d

commit_message:
Ceph-RGW: Fix configmap-bin template

This changes the conditional check for including the configmap-bin
template in the ceph-rgw chart to their original state, and also
adds the rgw-s3-admin.sh script that was removed unintentionally

Change-Id: I60c3660a5bca37199effcf74f3060059345a327b

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh

As part of removing reliance on the old and deprecated zuul-cloner, we
need to shift constraints declaration to the deps line. This means we
unfortunately have to duplicate the extras declarations into
test-requirements - because otherwise the contraints for
keystonemiddleware conflicts with the installation of itself.

Conflicts:
 Updated tox.ini to pull stable/rocky constraints

Change-Id: I8dbb31d1c1fda6df386f456dcf1d8bbed6d168ce
(cherry picked from commit 9a6875d479c22b81b47f545253f674a8c6221331)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 21:02:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh

This patch removes a legacy tool for installing tox which started
breaking stable branches based on openstack-requirements. This is a
handcrafted version of the following patch:

  If162dde93423a495064c4ae1a5dad4e7eb8f9577

This wasn't a direct cherry-pick due to the conflicts with refactoring
to use doc/requirements.txt

Change-Id: I8c726cc54aeab8fdad52bdaffa320bad4c5a5a28
(cherry picked from commit dfdd0789a6de6c3505bd9e9693c59fa9d9222aea)

which is only used for log hashing.

launch_instance_private_net: update openstack call syntax

This patch replaces the deprecated syntax (openstack ip floating list)
with the new one (openstack floating ip list).

Change-Id: I8b867759b8492033eb8602ad98f516af94da8a48
